alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 2:41AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Cherry, northern Rock, northern Brown and Keya Paha Counties through 330 AM CDT/230 AM MDT/... At 239 AM CDT/139 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles north of Medicine Lake to 6 miles southwest of Wewela. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Springview, Newport, Johnstown, Medicine Lake, Merritt Reservoir, Norden, Crookston, Wood Lake, Burton, Smith Falls State Park, Antelope Peak, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River, Indian Hill, Nets Peak and Steer Creek Campground. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 197 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 170 and 172, and between mile markers 177 and 229. Highway 61 near mile marker 223. Highway 97 between mile markers 109 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 190 and 218. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock; Western Cherry
